content: good grief yarn & provisions percussion by mariah ricciuto of good grief yarn & provisions percussion is a triangle shaped scarf knit in garter stitch with a lace hole edging needle & notion requirements 4 5mm 32-40 circular needles or size needed to obtain gauge scissors tapestry needle gauge 19 sts x 46 row = 4 10cm in garter stitch on 4 5mm needles or size needed to obtain gauge after blocking yarn requirements you will need 1 ball of either yarnalia wooly or cascade pacific 100g/200m 2 balls of drops merino extra fine 50g/110m or 3 balls of sandnes garn peer gynt 50g/91m or 185m of dk or worsted weight yarn sizing & fit the percussion scarf is one size with the following measurements approximately 45 long and 9 wide examples example 1 yarnalia wooly in colour whipped cream abbreviations k knit yo yarn-over p purl st s stitch es percussion casting on & set up row cast on 4 sts onto 4 5mm circular needles 32-40 knit 1 row lace-hole set-up row k2 yo k2 increases increase row k2 yo knit until 2 sts remain yo k2 repeat this increase row a total of 92 times or until you have 189 sts on your needles a total of 184 sts have been increased final edging row 1 lace hole row k2 *yo k2* until 2 sts remain yo k2 row 2 moss stitch k2 *p1 k2tog* until 2 sts remain p1 k2 row 3 moss stitch k2 *p1 k1* until 3 sts remain p1 k2 cast off using method of choice finishing weave in all loose ends and block your finished scarf now you re ready to wear your cozy scarf don t forget to tag @goodgriefyarnshop on ig
